alert.note: Alert for Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Smyth and Tazewell Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 414 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Raven, or 9 miles northeast of Lebanon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Richlands... Tazewell... Saltville... Chilhowie... Cedar Bluff... and Mount Rogers National Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
